metadata.title: CVE-2024-26781 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mptcp:fix possible deadlock in subflow diag Syzbot and Eric reported a lockdepsplat in the subflow diag: WARNING: possible circular locking dependencydetected 6.8.0-rc4-syzkaller-00212-g40b9385dd8e6 #0 Not taintedsyz-executor.2/24141 is trying to acquire lock: ffff888045870130(k-sk_lock-AF_INET6){+.+.}-{0:0}, at: tcp_diag_put_ulpnet/ipv4/tcp_diag.c:100 [inline] ffff888045870130(k-sk_lock-AF_INET6){+.+.}-{0:0}, at: tcp_diag_get_aux+0x738/0x830net/ipv4/tcp_diag.c:137 but task is already holding lock: ffffc9000135e488(&h->lhash2[i].lock){+.+.}-{2:2}, at: spin_lockinclude/linux/spinlock.h:351 [inline] ffffc9000135e488(&h->lhash2[i].lock){+.+.}-{2:2}, at: inet_diag_dump_icsk+0x39f/0x1f80net/ipv4/inet_diag.c:1038 which lock already depends on the new lock. theexisting dependency chain (in reverse
